DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalized Ratio Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a medical procedure was performed that involves testing a sample of blood for the International Normalized Ratio, established by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting) tests, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure International Normalized Ratio Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for the International Normalized Ratio, established by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting) tests, as a method of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: System established by the World Health Organization and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for monitoring and reporting blood coagulation tests. Under this system, results are standardized using the International Sensitivity Index for the particular test reagent/instrument combination used.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A system, commonly called the INR, established by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosis and Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting) tests. All results are standardized using the international sensitivity index (ISI) for the particular thromboplastin reagent and instrument combination utilized to perform the test; the ratio of a patient's clotting time to the lab's mean reference value is normalized against the ISI. (from medterms.com and medicine.ucsf.edu)
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: An international normalized ratio (INR) <= 1.5 (patients who are therapeutically anti-coagulated for unrelated medical conditions such as atrial fibrillation and whose anti-thrombotic treatment can be withheld for operation will be eligible)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: International Normalized Ration (INR) <=1.5 x institutional normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: INR <= 1.5 x institutional ULN unless patient is therapeutically anticoagulated in which case the INR must be within appropriate anticoagulation limits for the clinical indication

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: International Normalized Ratio (INR) <= 1.5 x institutional ULN unless patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy in which case the INR must be within the therapeutic range of intended use for the anticoagulant

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: International Normalized Ratio (INR) <=1.5 x institutional ULN unless patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy, in which case the INR or PT must be within the therapeutic range of intended use for the anticoagulant

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this patient's International Normalized Ratio (INR) less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is international normalized ratio (INR) less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN (or an in-range INR, usually between 2 and 3, if a patient is on a stable dose of therapeutic warfarin) within 14 days of registration?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
